title: What is the biggest star close to our solar system? - Quora

response.answer_text: Sirius To be more precise its Sirius A, as there are two stars in the Sirius system, a large bright one, and a white dwarf, which is the slowly cooling core of an old star, which weight about the same as our sun but is the size of the Earth! Anyways Sirius A is 8.6 LY away, 25 times as bright as our Sun.
Gacrux 88 light years away is the closest red giant with a radius 84 times that of the sun. Gacrux - Wikipedia
